wikipedia_page.main: Nicholas Michell (4 June 1807 – 6 April 1880), was a Cornish writer, best known for his poetry.

response: *Nicholas Michell (1807–1880) a Cornish writer, best known for his poetry
He was appointed Deputy Lieutenant of the West Riding of Yorkshire. He died at Well House in 1879. His second daughter Maria married poet Nicholas Michell.
*Nicholas Michell (1807–1880), poetWilliam Henry Kearley Wright, West-country poets: their lives and works (1896) p. 330
